Different '''[[panorama]]s''' have been used in the [[menu screen]]s in both {{JE}} and {{BE}}, but they have been replaced for various reasons, such as a new [[Named update|update]] with a different theme. This page documents all such panoramas.

== Prototype ==
[[File:Menu Panorama Revision 0.png|thumb|The unreleased menu screen panorama that came before the final version.]]

[[Dinnerbone]] had stated that the menu panorama was originally going to be an in-game render of a live world, with custom world generation with the seed <code>100</code>. He also mentioned another panorama that came before the one seen in [[Java Edition Beta 1.8|Beta 1.8]], which depicted a [[plains]] biome near a [[beach]].<ref>{{Reddit|url=hthrmk/big_news_we_have_found_the_seed_of_minecrafts|comment=fyherp0|title=Interesting stuff, nice work!<br /><br />The first title screen panorama was actually originally in-game render of a live world, with custom worldgen and the seed <del>"splash"</del> <code>100</code>. I would have figured this was a screenshot from that, but consider me surprised and impressed! :D<br /><br />Edit: It turns out that was an even earlier panorama, and the one in this post came later. The first one was never released, though. Here's a screenshot of what it would have looked like: <nowiki>[link to screenshot on Discord]</nowiki>|author=Dinnerbone|date=July 18, 2020}}</ref>
{{-}}

[[File:Menu Panorama in-game.png|thumb|The original menu panorama in-game. (Coordinates: X≈61.48, Y=75, Z≈-68.73)]]

This panorama was introduced to {{JE}} in [[Java Edition Beta 1.8|Beta 1.8]]'s early development and used for over six years before its replacement in [[Java Edition 1.13-pre1|1.13-pre1]].

The panorama used in {{BE}} was identical to the one used in ''Java Edition''. When this panorama was first introduced in ''Bedrock Edition'', it had used the version which fixed the white line inside of it.

This panorama was also in the Early Access builds of {{EE}}.

This panorama had been taken on the seed {{cd|2151901553968352745}} or {{cd|8091867987493326313}} (both are considered valid seeds) at coordinates <code>X=61.48 / Y=75 / Z=-68.73</code>. The seed {{cd|2151901553968352745}} spawns the player in a [[plains]] biome at -156, 244. The panorama distance direction is {{distdir|-156|244|61|-68}}. These seeds work in versions from [[Java Edition Alpha v1.2.0|Alpha v1.2.0]] to [[Java Edition Beta 1.7.3|Beta 1.7.3]] (except for population differences).<ref name=":0">{{reddit|url=hthrmk|title=BIG NEWS! We have found the SEED of Minecraft's title-screen background PANORAMA!|author=Tomlacko|date=July 18, 2020}}</ref> The actual version that was used to generate this panorama must have been a development version between [[Java Edition Beta 1.6.6|Beta 1.6.6]] and [[Java Edition Beta 1.7|Beta 1.7]], based on the file dates. [[Dinnerbone]] noted that the panorama was taken by [[Notch]] while he was travelling, around June 1–15, 2011.<ref>https://discord.com/channels/720723932738486323/721776112014721096/738514461597630535</ref><ref>https://discord.com/channels/720723932738486323/721776112014721096/738517623637016706</ref>

In ''Java Edition'', this panorama is used from [[Java Edition Beta 1.8 Pre-release|Beta 1.8 Pre-release]] to [[Java Edition 18w22c|18w22c]] (includes [[Java Edition 2.0|2.0]], [[15w14a]], and [[1.RV-Pre1]]).

In ''Bedrock Edition'', this panorama is used from [[Pocket Edition v0.7.3 alpha|v0.7.3 alpha]] to [[Pocket Edition 1.1.7|1.1.7]]. The constituent image files were blurred.

In ''Minecraft Education'', this panorama is used from its [[Education Edition early access|initial release]] to [[Education Edition 1.0.1|1.0.1]]. 

This panorama was never used in [[Legacy Console Edition]], as that edition had [[Legacy Console Edition panoramas|its own set of panoramas]]. Usage of this panorama in other editions is unknown.

The panoramas used {{in|je|be}} are different. It is also the first time the panorama changed in ''Java Edition'', six and a half years since the original.

The panorama for ''Java Edition'' was taken on the seed {{cd|18w22a}} (numeric: {{cd|1458140401}}) at coordinates <code>X=1553.76 / Y=58.62 / Z=-1162.79</code>. This seed spawns the player in a [[plains]] Biome at 236, -212, distance direction is {{distdir|236|-212|1553.76|-1162.79}} in the [[warm ocean]] biome. This seed generates most correctly in version [[18w22a]].<ref name="MC@H">{{cite|url=https://mcatho.me/panorama|title=Minecraft title-screen seeds|website=Google Sheets|author=Minecraft@Home|date=December 31, 2020}}</ref> The seed used to generate the ''Bedrock Edition'' panorama is unknown.

In ''Java Edition'', this panorama is used for versions from [[Java Edition 1.13-pre1|1.13-pre1]] to [[Java Edition 1.13.2|1.13.2]]. Before the panorama was changed to reflect [[Village & Pillage]], it was also used in [[Java Edition 1.14|1.14]] snapshots from [[Java Edition 18w43a|18w43a]] to [[Java Edition 18w47b|18w47b]].

In ''Bedrock Edition'', this panorama was used for versions from [[Bedrock Edition beta 1.5.0.4|beta 1.5.0.4]] to [[Bedrock Edition 1.8.0|1.8.0]] and beta versions from [[Bedrock Edition beta 1.9.0.0|beta 1.9.0.0]] to [[Bedrock Edition beta 1.9.0.3|beta 1.9.0.3]].

{{IN|education}}, this panorama was used for versions from [[Education Edition 1.7|1.7]] to [[Education Edition 1.7.3|1.7.3]].

This seed spawns the player in a [[forest]] biome at 136, 56. Distance direction is {{distdir|136|56|339.691|-1072.041}} in [[plains]] biome. This seed generates mostly correct in version [[19w40a]].<ref name="MC@H"/>

The panorama for ''Java Edition'' was introduced in [[Java Edition 19w41a|19w41a]] and was used until [[Java Edition 1.15.2|1.15.2]] (includes [[Java Edition Combat Test 4|Combat Test 4]] to [[Java Edition Combat Test 5|Combat Test 5]]). It was also used in [[Java Edition 1.16|1.16]] snapshots from [[Java Edition 20w06a|20w06a]] to [[Java Edition 20w13b|20w13b]].

This panorama in [[Bedrock Edition beta 1.14.0.1]] is different from ''Java Edition''. It is taken in the same seed at the same coordinates but with the initial view in a different direction. The same vegetation appears, but with different clouds.

In [[Bedrock Edition beta 1.14.0.2|beta 1.14.0.2]], this panorama had been changed to be similar to the panorama in ''Java Edition'', with the only difference being the clouds. <samp>panorama_5.png</samp> is identical to the file used in ''Java Edition''. The modified version is used for [[Bedrock Edition beta 1.14.0.2|beta 1.14.0.2]] to [[Bedrock Edition beta 1.16.0.55|beta 1.16.0.55]].

The panorama in [[Education Edition 1.14.31]] is different from other editions. It is taken on the seed {{cd|190800072}} and was used in versions from [[Education Edition 1.14.31|1.14.31]] to [[Education Edition 1.14.32|1.14.32]].

This panorama had been taken on the seed {{cd|2151901553968352745}} at coordinates <code>X=4.83 / Y=130.15 / Z=-7294.28</code>. This seed spawns the player in a [[windswept hills]] biome at 0, 0. Distance direction is {{distdir|0|0|4.83|-7294.28}} in a [[snowy taiga]] biome. This seed generates mostly correct on snapshot [[21w40a]].<ref>{{ytl|gE1dMNCyofs|We found the 1.18 Minecraft Title Screen Panorama!|Minecraft@Home|October 23, 2021}}</ref> Interestingly, this seed is exactly the same seed as the one used in the original panorama that was present in the game from Beta 1.8 until the Update Aquatic. This was an [[Easter eggs|easter egg]] put in the game by [[Jasper Boerstra|Jappa]], thought to be inspired by a tweet.<ref>{{tweet|Kuba01486712|1441386396099489792|If you are looking for the seed for new panorama, what about the seed of first Minecraft panorama? It would be cool to see how it changed!|September 24, 2021}}</ref> He later confirmed that this was indeed an homage that put emphasis on how much Minecraft had changed over the years.<ref>{{tweet|JasperBoerstra|1451958163926921219|We thought the seed for the new panorama was a nice homage and put emphasis on how much Minecraft has changed over the past years :)|October 23, 2021}}</ref>

In ''Java Edition'', this panorama was introduced in [[Java Edition 21w41a|21w41a]] and was used until [[Java Edition 1.18.2|1.18.2]] (includes [[Java Edition Deep Dark Experimental Snapshot 1|Deep Dark Experimental Snapshot 1]] and [[Java Edition 22w13oneBlockAtATime|22w13oneBlockAtATime]]), and was also used in [[Java Edition 1.19|1.19]] snapshots from [[Java Edition 22w11a|22w11a]] to [[Java Edition 22w14a|22w14a]].

In ''Bedrock Edition'', this panorama is used in versions from [[Bedrock Edition beta 1.18.0.21|beta 1.18.0.21]] to [[Bedrock Edition beta 1.19.0.20|beta 1.19.0.20]].

{{IN|education}}, this panorama is used in versions from [[Education_Edition_1.18.32|1.18.32]] to [[Education_Edition_1.18.45|1.18.45]].

The panorama for both {{els|JE|BE}} was taken on the [[World seed|seed]] <code>8819392414030687460</code> at coordinates <code>X=1266 / Y=105 / Z=-125</code>in ''Java Edition''. The world spawn of this seed is in a [[bamboo jungle]] biome at coordinates <code>X=0 / Y=102 / Z=0</code> and the coordinates <code>X=1266 / Y=105 / Z=-125</code> are located in a [[birch forest]] 1272 blocks to the west.

In ''Java Edition'', this panorama was introduced in [[Java Edition 25w20a|25w20a]] and was used until [[Java Edition 1.21.8|1.21.8]]. It was also used in three [[Java Edition 1.21.9|1.21.9]] snapshots, [[Java Edition 25w31a|25w31a]], [[Java Edition 25w32a|25w32a]] and [[Java Edition 25w33a|25w33a]].

In ''Bedrock Edition'', this panorama was introduced in [[Bedrock Edition Preview 1.21.90.28|Preview 1.21.90.28]].

A separate panorama was introduced in [[Bedrock Edition Preview 1.21.90.26]] to be exclusively used when [[Vibrant Visuals]] are turned on. The [[Settings#Vibrant Visuals Options|brightness]] of this panorama is affected by the Vibrant Visuals brightness setting.

Two panoramas only used in ''Bedrock Edition'' ''[[Minecraft Preview|Previews]]'' were taken in ''Bedrock Edition'' on the same seed around the same coordinates. The first panorama is located in coordinates <code>X=1266, Y=109, Z=-126</code>, and the second one is in coordinates <code>X=1266, Y=108, Z=-127</code>. The first panorama was used only for version [[Bedrock Edition Preview 1.21.90.25|Preview 1.21.90.25]], and the second panorama was used for versions [[Bedrock Edition Preview 1.21.90.26|Preview 1.21.90.26]] and [[Bedrock Edition Preview 1.21.90.27|Preview 1.21.90.27]] while Vibrant Visuals was disabled.

The standard panorama was taken {{in|JE}},{{note|Two villages can be seen in the standard panorama, one that generates only {{in|JE}} visible in {{code|panorama_3.png}}, and one that generates only {{in|BE}} at the location that the panorama was taken. Both panoramas were taken in worlds using the [[World seed|seed]] <code>7904846446833094596</code> at coordinates <code>X=119 / Y=65 / Z=-6271</code>. The world spawn of this seed is in an [[old growth birch forest]] at <code>X=16 / Y=67 / Z=-32</code> and the coordinates <code>X=119 / Y=65 / Z=-6271</code> are located in a [[plains]] biome 6240 blocks to the south.
